Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix: Remove GPU layer forcing from service images for iOS stability

translateZ\(0\) and backface-visibility: hidden were creating separate
GPU compositor layers for each service image. On iOS Safari with its
strict GPU memory limits, this combined with the Three.js Canvas was
causing crashes when scrolling past the second service card.

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix: Disable WebGL Canvas on iOS to prevent crashes

iOS Safari has strict GPU memory limits \(~100-200MB\). The site had two
WebGL Canvas elements \(LandingPage with complex glass materials,
TransitionPage\) which exceeded these limits, causing crashes when
scrolling.

Now detects iOS devices and renders simple HTML fallbacks instead of
WebGL content. Desktop and Android devices still get the full 3D
experience.
